M01 - Space Travel.string: Cart was independent by the time it made the first track connection

M02 - Solar Panel Array.string: Solar Panels need to be angled toward or away from you, depending on strategy and conditions.
Your Solar Panel is Angled toward the other team's field
Both Solar Panels are angled towards the same field

M03 - 3D Printing.string: 2x4 Brick completely ejected from the printer by placing a Regolith Core Sample into it
Brick completely in Northeast Planet Area

M04 - Crater Crossing.string: Robot or Agent crossed completely east to west between the towers

M05 - Extraction.string: All samples moved no longer touching Core Site Model Axis
Gas Core Sample touching the mat and completely in the Lander’s Target Circle
Gas Core Sample completely in Base
Water Core Sample supported only by the Food Growth Chamber

M06 - Space Station Modules.string: Tube Module in Habitation Hub Port West Side, touching nothing but the Habitation Hub
Docking Module in Habitation Hub Port East Side, touching nothing but the Habitation Hub

M07 - Space Walk Emergency.string: The Robot needs to get Gerhard’s body into the Airlock Chamber.

choices.string: Gerhard’s body not in airlock chamber
Gerhard’s body partially in airlock chamber
Gerhard’s body completely in airlock chamber

M08 - Aerobic Exercise.string: Exercise Machine Pointer advanced only by moving one or both of the Handle Assemblies

choices.string: Completely in gray, or partly covering either of gray’s end-borders
Completely in white
Completely in orange, or partly covering either of orange’s end-borders

M09 - Strength Exercise.string: The Robot lifted the Strength Bar to a scoring height so that the tooth-strip’s 4th hole comes at least partly into view?

choices.string: No
Yes

M10 - Food Production.string: Food Growth Chamber’s colors spun, by moving the Push Bar, so the gray weight is DROPPED after green, but before tan?

choices.string: No
Yes

M11 - Escape Velocity.string: The Robot hit the Strike Pad hard enough to keep the spacecraft from dropping back down?

choices.string: No
Yes

M12 - Satellite Orbits.string: The Robot needs to move one or more Satellites to the Outer Orbit.

choices.string: No satellites moved into orbit
1 moved between the two lines of the Outer Orbit
2 moved between the two lines of the Outer Orbit
3 moved between the two lines of the Outer Orbit

M13 - Observatory.string: Rotate the Observatory to a precise direction.

choices.string: Tip not in any coloured section
Tip completely in gray, or partly covering either of gray’s end-borders
Tip completely in white
Tip completely in orange, or partly covering either of orange’s end-borders

M14 - Meteoroid Deflection.string: Meteoroids clearly independent whilst west of the free-line
Meteoroids hit/released while clearly and completely west of free line

M15 - Landing Touch-Down.string: Get the Lander to one of its targets intact, or at least get it to Base.

choices.string: Failed to get lander to target or base
Both parts of the Lander completely into Base
Lander  intact, touching the Mat, and completely in the Northeast Planet Area
Lander intact, touching the Mat, and completely in its Target Circle
1 (-3 points)
2 (-6 points)
3 (-9 points)
4 (-12 points)
5 (-15 points)
6 (-18 points)
